1.text: Today, I'm gonna show you a really cool way to make slicing an onion, really simple.

7.text: Sometimes when you're trying to cut an onion, it all breaks apart as you're cutting it

12.text: And you have to use the knife very close to your fingers

17.text: But I'm gonna show you how you can use a hair pick, like this, to make your life easier.

23.text: Make sure it's nice and strong with stainless steel prongs.

27.text: Place your onion on a chopping board

36.text: If you want to make onion rings, stand it on it's end, and push the hair pick straight through the middle of it like this.

50.text: Then take your knife and cut in between each prong.

56.text: The hair pick will keep it all together and give you nice even slices.

68.text: And you can open them out into rings!

78.text: If you want to dice your onion; slide the pick into one half

84.text: And do exactly the same again.

89.text: The hair clip will keep it nicely together and keep it all nice and neat.

95.text: Turn it 90 degrees and start slicing again.

101.text: Then turn it around, and start from the other side.

105.text: It's a really useful tool. And it makes things safer too because you don't get your fingers anywhere near the knife blade.

114.text: You can also use it for other fruit and veg to help give you nice, even slices.

126.text: It works really well with tomatoes.

133.text: You could spread out the slices for a nice salad.

141.text: Or they're perfect for making sandwiches.

149.text: And if you're making drinks for a party and want to add a slice of lemon

153.text: Using one of these to help you out makes it really easy.
